TopicTitle: My assembly hall is too small, is there a solution for this??

Articles.Content: I am building a rather large construction, but to get the thing functional I must make it even bigger, but I already reached the limit of the assembly hall. Is there a workaround for this?

Get Editor Extensions.

+1 essential mod.

Also consider picking up Subassembly Manager, since it's going to prove invaluable for working on larger ships, especially if you want to send them up piecemeal.

Damn, for some reason the plugin simply refuses to do anything at all, its in the right folder and all but the thing is just sitting there....

Iv'e put the plug in Gamedata and plugindata, nothing...? I have version 19.1, maybe I must update?

If your rocket is to high you can cheat a bit, cut rocket in two, take the root node pod or probe and place top on top of it and bottom below, you can now push to top part past the roof. You can also push the bottom down in the floor.

I am building a rather large construction, but to get the thing functional I must make it even bigger, but I already reached the limit of the assembly hall. Is there a workaround for this?

what are you building that's that big anyways?

Damn, for some reason the plugin simply refuses to do anything at all, its in the right folder and all but the thing is just sitting there....

Iv'e put the plug in Gamedata and plugindata, nothing...? I have version 19.1, maybe I must update?

odd, I'm sure I've had it installed since .19.x at least, though if the plugin was updated since then you may need to update to support it.

It doesn't really make any obvious changes, just increases the interior size of the vab, it's hard to even notice it's working except for you having more space to build bigger things.
Editor Extensions only works with .20. The new GameData format wasn't there in .19, so it's normal it doesn't work. Colonel_Panic, you must've been using Edtools by DEADBEEF back then.
okay, i've updated my kerbals and now everything works as promised, thanx guys.
